Reviews.Title: “Older, but clean and well maintained”
Reviews.Author: Pete S
Reviews.Content: I have read several of the reviews for the Lexington Hotel, and was extremely concerned about my upcoming stay there. However, my experience was not like many that I read. The hotel must have been recently remodeled, as our room was clean and had a contemporary decor. Sure there were signs of a fifty-year old hotel visible, but the overall experience and value made the stay worthwhile. The staff was super, especially our desk clerk Jennifer, and the pool area was nicely landscaped and maintained. The Lexington Hotel should be judged based upon what it is: an older hotel complex off the highway, not a luxury resort. I'll stay here again, especially at the rate I paid for St Patrick's weekend 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, Old and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: MiCowboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks like it was a Holiday Inn from the 60's in a former life. It is run down and tired. Pool area is nice, rooms are big but carpet is way past it's prime, tubs are small and not real safe for standing in for a shower, bed is ok but small pillows. Rooms open to outdoor hallways and doors are not sealed very well so you hear everything going on outside. The best part of the room is the Amana AC unit in the wall, very quite, easy to sleep with it on. I was not happy with the $8.00 "Resort Fee" extra for the bus to take you downtown. If you are on a motorcycle don't pay it as there are many easy free parking places for bike.

Reviews.Title: “A student hotel”
Reviews.Author: metung
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 'annexe' which is a 3 story building with car parking underneath. The rooms are rather tired, though kept clean throughout, bed comfortable, a good shower though smaller than others we have been in, a single cup coffee maker with 2 coffee bags provided, and an old TV which often didn't work due to the signal failing, There were plenty of drawers, a desk and hanging space. The front door leads off an external passageway and when closed firmly could be felt around the building. The 'aircon' was efficient and could be controlled easily but was quite noisy. We were unfortunate to spend 6 nights when students were holidaying and partying in the rooms around. The last night was noisy all night and the management failed to deal with any complaints. However we were disturbed by rowdy behaviour at some stage during all the nights we were there, including a rather unpleasant domestic row between a couple of guests. The surrounding area suffers from heavy traffic being in the place that it is located. The swimming pool is good though the rules were broken by lots of swimmers, notably by smoking. Parking is free with some under cover spaces. Our hire car was damaged overnight whilst parked by the block. There is a restaurant on site which closed at 10pm and refused to serve coffee to us after a meal at 9.30pm. The food was fairly good but wine was sold by the glass only, for $7. This hotel was booked by our travel company and given the problems we had, I certainly would not recommend it as a place to stay for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential college spring break hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bryanrn
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in March, which happened to be spring break...the first room was so musty that we refused to stay in it. The second room was better...basic, worn, fairly clean. This is not a resort though, do not think that it is a resort. There is a resort fee of $8 or so a day, but it is worth it for the shuttle that runs most of the day to take you to Duval st.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: oklahomatraveling
Reviews.Content: Came to Key West for a one night stay to find hotel rooms are very pricey. Found a room at the Lexington "hotel" staff was nice at check in even gave us cards for a one bus pass for Key West. Found our room in a 3 story building which I consider a motel. Carpet very nasty, door barely closed, air conditioner was very loud and kicked off and on all night waking us everytime. It is very close to a busy street and kept us awake. Drunks ran up and down the very unsturdy concrete balcony all hours of the night. As well as the drains in the sink and toilet both neither drained. Along with just a filthy dirty room all the way around. Upon check out staff argued in front of us about what they wanted to do for us. They were nice to us and did discount the room $50 and gave us a free breakfast. But to think we still paid $160 for a room that bad is sickening. I just hope we aren't taking home roaches and bed bugs!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break motel, only worse”
Reviews.Author: HRharleyriders
Reviews.Content: 300.00 per night, gets you this crappy worn out, run down dirty hotel/motel room in Key West. The bathroom was dirty, the carpet was dirty, the bed was worn out, towels were small and rank. I was afraid to lay my hairbrush down on the sink. Run away, run away. The Best Western had sold out, so looking on Orbitz we found this place. One of three left with vacancy. I made the mistake of going by the pictures. Ewe. Never again. The hotel staff was nice, but man this place needs a major overhaul. I recommned you find something else. 1 Star rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Bug problems.”
Reviews.Author: jamiecolvard
Reviews.Content: Decent pool, not the best location, not the cleanest room. We had bugs in our room and called the front desk, they sent someone up with spray to kill the bugs but did not move us. Instead they gave us a $25 voucher to the restaurant next door. The gentleman at the front desk was very friendly and helped us with the shuttle and gave us a map of Key West. However, it didn't seem as though he had any authority to do anything more than give the $25 voucher in the bug situation. Disappointing. We will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service”
Reviews.Author: koraltop
Reviews.Content: Nice service at the reception and pool was great for the kids. The rooms are worn - our carpet looked like it hadn't been cleaned in quite a while! And the air-con was not too great. Stay clear of the neighbour resturant: InKahoots - food is at best mediocre and the service horrible. One girl was either stoned or plain drunk... she was all over the place.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are deceiving.”
Reviews.Author: sjackson_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend and based on the pictures ii did not think it was a bad price. We paid 386 for our two night stay. The hotel is very old and run down. Dont hafve many amenties in the room. the head board was leaning on one of the beds too. One of the bed frames broke when we sat on it as well. Stay clear of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'll ve back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Susylez
Reviews.Content: Very nice people working there, so friendly. The hotel rooms were amazing, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel....”
Reviews.Author: ladyg0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights during what was apparently a peak season. Although I found the price to be a bit steep, it is about the same as many other hotels in the area. Our room was one overlooking the pool, and had a king-sized bed, a sofa and tile floors. Via Priceline, I was able to get the room for less than $200 a night. On the downside, the Tiki bar at the pool did not appear to be open during the day on Saturday, there is no shuttle service to the downtown area (at the opposite end of the island) and no continental/buffett breakfast. In addition, if you are a light sleeper, the noise from the vehicles entering/departing Key West may be too much for you. There were minor cosmetic repairs needed to the room, but nothing that would prevent me from staying there again. On the plus side, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, Internet access is free, there is a "concierge" service in the lobby that can assist you with acquiring a cab and planning outings on the water, there is a restaurant immediately next door to the hotel for breakfast, lunch and dinner, there is plenty of free parking, pool towels are available in the hotel lobby and the pool/jacuzzi area are nice. Not a five star hotel, but not a bad hotel, either.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Devon C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and it was 1 night too many. We were aware it was 3+ miles outside of town, that was ok. But the room was disgusting. There was visible feces in the toilet, the room stunk like a combination of stale cigarette smoke (it was a non-smoking room) and mildew/ mold. The carpet was dirty and smelly. If it weren't for the beds being made I'd swear they didn't clean it before we arrived. When I left I asked for a receipt and the front desk lady told me she couldn't provide me with one since her printer was acting up, and offered no apologies. She was just like, well too bad! The only thing that helped a little was that I called the general manager after our stay to inform her how awful our experience was, and that it was shameful that we paid as much as we did for such a disgusting place. She refunded half of the room price back to me, and was very polite and apologetic. From reading other reviews I'm thinking I'm not the only one who she's spoken with. We will definitely NOT be staying here again and I don't recommend you do either.

Reviews.Title: “Sucks!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffreyasp
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week, there was noting else available arround, worst hotel I have ever stayed in so far, bathrooms were outdated, carpets stained,It was pretty dirty overall, sink was clogged, stuff was rude, drawers under the tv wouldn't open, no soap in shower, enternet connection was poor , and to top everything last nite I woke up in the middle of the night and there was at least 5 freacking cockroaches having a party in the bathroom floor.

Reviews.Title: “Help yourself... Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: luckymuf06
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. Not bad, but terrible. My husband and I love Miami, so we decided to venture down to Key West and see how it was. The island itself was neat. Duval Street was a fun place to go. We walked around there for a few hours at night. Many shops to go in and many places to eat. The hotel... Bad. We were on the second floor and the balcony area seemed very unsafe. The floors in our room... Damp. We could not wear socks because they got wet... The shower was terrible. Sure looked like mold growing around the base. Honestly, everything about this place was bad. If I could have afforded to leave and go somewhere else, I would have. The worst hotel I have ever stayed at. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Diaper Stain- Lexington”
Reviews.Author: 14Melissa
Reviews.Content: The Lexington Hotel, great pool view? Yes. Nice room? Hell no! This would be the nastiest, grodiest, filth--hole abomination on this freaking earth. It was like we walked into a livable dumpster. 2 queen size beds, hhmmm decent. The icky floors, moldy old bathroom, and crappy little T.V.... not so much. Where was the complimentary flat screen T.V and clean cozy room we were promised? We couldn't even regulate the temperature in that musty box!!! 64 degrees all the time. And the extra non-smoking fee you got a pay for clean air, and for what? Everyone freaking smokes right out of your rotted paned window. Room service would never come at their sceduled time. What flipping rat nest of a hotel doesn't have copied memos out to everyone how works there. It never failed, the 3 nights we stayed here we had to call for someone to clean out our room. It was like they totally avoided the bathroom so there was always a pee smell lingering in the walls! I can't even fit all the problems about that hotel here. Jacuzzi- Room temperature Shower- Rotting Veiw- What veiw? Balcony- Creaky, falling apart 2nd floor- Felt like you were gonna fall through the floor Key West in General- SUCKS (Theres no beach)(Tainted by loud city and rude tourists)

Reviews.Title: “Wi Fi didn't work and no TV”
Reviews.Author: Williecmo
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and tried it any way. Could be a really nice place. Loved the pool and setting. But...the TV was out for the whole complex and they couldn't make the Wi Fi work try as they might with the provider. For the ridiculous price of this place (I know...it was Key West), this was unacceptable. I paid less for a 5 star in downtown San Francisco last summer. They offered to let me use their computer in the the office, but who wants to do that unless it was an emergency. Theirs was hard wired and worked OK. Luckily I was able to connect Wi Fi signal from the Days Inn next door. Also had bad stains on the rug and I could feel broken concrete next to one wall underneath it.

Reviews.Title: “Good rates, decent stay!”
Reviews.Author: wvlabgirl
Reviews.Content: This place has a great rate, especially if you're just planning on sleeping and showering at your hotel, which is what we did. Our room, 455, had a great water view from the balcony, which was a pleasant surprise. While it wasn't fancy, the room was clean and quiet. The beds were very comfy, and the housekeepers did a great job every day. The hotel's pool and pool area is beautiful. We had great service at check-in and check-out. Honestly, I don't understand the negative comments. If you're expecting the Waldorf, stay there, it's a few miles down the road. If you're looking for decent accommodations and don't want to spend lots on a room that you're barely going to be in, then this is a great stay. I'm happy to have a budget-friendly clean hotel room with not a lot of frills, I'll spend a few dollars on a cab ride and keep the rest of my money for great dining and fun in town. Thanks to the staff, keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “A decent place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Linda H
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst thing was check-in. It was a little difficult. We had 5 people and 2 different reservations, and I think it was a communication problem but it was all figured out. Actually they were very accomodating, we were able to get our rooms a little early and had a late check out. The people that complain about everything at the hotel, well... if you want a really nice place to stay you're going to have to spend at least $200 a night, probably more. I'm not sure what they were expecting. I really don't have anything to complain about. The rooms were nice and clean, didn't notice any smell. It's an older hotel but in good shape. There were a lot of people there, but during the day, not many people by the pool or pool bar. The pool was nice sized and clean. The pool bar wasn't crowded and the bartenders were really nice and gave us some places we should visit. There is some traffic noise at the pool since the hotel is right at the "T" where the main highway connects, but I didn't think it was that bad. There are several restaurants within walking distance, and they have their own attached restaurant, nothing fancy but decent food. We were around the hotel during most days and headed downtown late afternoon and stayed to shop and hit some bars in the evening. Weather was fantastic for mid January. The sight seeing trolley was maybe a half block to get to. I would recommend this if it's your first time, lots of information about Key West, you get to see lots of the cool houses, and learn the history about the town. This was my 2nd trip to Key West, but stayed at another place on the first trip. I would stay there again. Key West if a lot of fun and lots to do!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: will_moss
Reviews.Content: Was told by "night manager" upon arriving that I only had the room for one night. Offered to get reservation receipt, was told there really wasn't anything he could do about it. Whatever. Got to the room, the room door wouldn't stay closed. Could just tap it open. Room was dirty. Especially the floors. Our feet got dirty from stepping out of the shower. The bed was extremely uncomfortable. Felt like sleeping on a piece of plywood. The next morning, we were on Duval St. and I got a text from my bank notifying me that I'd been charged again for my stay. Called the hotel, they said I had to come back to deal with the situation. Spent half my day to deal with the situation. Found out the additional charge came when the "night manager" decided to bill someone else's room to my card. Manager promised to refund the entire stay and the additional charge. Still hasn't followed through. I checked out and went to the Travelodge just up the street. It was a much nicer place. Ocean view rooms for only $30 more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Worst”
Reviews.Author: beckywils
Reviews.Content: We were promised 2 Queen beds, They moved us to a room with a water leak that poured on us while on the toilet, from the ceiling. We got moved again to a room that again had double beds not queens. At least it didn't smell as bad. The rooms were beat and old. So we were moved 3 times. Please don't stay there!!!! Needs work!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible... no privacy... feel violated”
Reviews.Author: E-Rock_Sizzle
Reviews.Content: Big Mistake! There was no peephole on our door, just a round hole where the peep hole should be. Anyone could have looked into our hotel room. The carpets and shower were gross. I wish I would have spent the extra $50 to stay at the Marriott across the street. This is place is not worth the money even if it is Key West. Splurge on a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “awful floors and smelly”
Reviews.Author: Marta C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there 3 days. The carpet floor was nasty and so did the bathroom. the bathtub was in a very poor condition and the smell of the drainage in the bathroom had a terrible disgusting sewer smell. Thanks goodness the sheets were clean at least!

Reviews.Title: “Great place on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Angela N
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lexington on a Saturday night. The maintenance guy helped us to take our suitcases upstairs which was really nice. Really enjoyed the pool and Tiki bar after our kayaking excursion. The hotel room was okay. The carpets were disgusting though. Really dirty. Beds were okay and the AC was good. The pictures of the pool area are pretty much right on, but the rooms are just average. The lady (Fran) in the restaurant was really helpful and gave us some advice for our short trip! Really appreciated her help. My friend forgot her phone charger in the room and when we called back, they were not very helpful at all. Put us through to an answering machine and have not heard back since then!

Reviews.Title: “Pick another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ireneMobile s
Reviews.Content: Do not make the mistake we made! The Lexington is an outdated hotel with paper thin walls. Although free internet is part of their package, we were very disappointed that it did not work our first night. An incompetent uninformed desk clerk gave several contradicting answers about the situation. It was very frustrating to be told it would be up and running in an hour and then not have service until the following evening. The room itself has little or no esthetic redeeming qualities. It was clean, that is the best i can say. The food in the restaurant was average. The service was pitiful. We had a waitress come to our table still chewing as she laid her empty plate on the ledge above our booth. She literally bounced off the walls. I will NEVER return to that hotel. i hope you will make a better choice!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Dump”
Reviews.Author: Betty L
Reviews.Content: I discovered much later that this was previously a Holiday Inn that had lost it's licence by neglecting maintenance issues.... easy to see why the licence was pulled ! First of all the carpet was worn and threadbare. Secondly, there was a picture that had been ripped from the wall and was neither replaced nor the wall repaired. The " whirlpool " was under repair. The fan in the bedroom made more noise than a 1927 model T Ford. The sheets didn't match and one bed was short a blanket. A dead roach in the bathroom had accumulated a swarm of ants. Our stay there was our 8th night on the road and has been the worst of this trip so far. Avoid this place at all costs !

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste you time.”
Reviews.Author: littlejimi
Reviews.Content: The guy at the counter when I checked in was a jerk. I had asked if there were any rooms available and how much they were? He said 139.95 I showed him my iphone which said 125.10 and he wouldn't honor that. He told me I had to make a reservation through the net. So I sat in the lobby and booked the room The carpet in the room was filthy and stained. The pool wasn't very clean. The pool bartender was extremly slow. The first day I ordered a margrita and on top was a fruit fly and an ant. However the next day I ordered a Pina Coloda fricking horrible, stuck to bottle beer after that. Noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kabmetsls
Reviews.Content: The Lexington Hotel was an excellent stay for the price. It was clean (updated carpets would be nice though) and the staff was courteous and friendly. I had a ln issue with a too soft bed and they immediately moved me to a different room. The hotel is a little far from downtown and w/o a shuttle driving is your only option. The price couldn't be beat though. The pool was fantastic and I enjoyed sunbathing. The wait staff was especially accommodating. I will be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Badly needs updated”
Reviews.Author: Tony4351
Reviews.Content: This hotel property is one of those that demonstrates the power of photoshop and wide angle camera lens. The rooms are very worn. My room had carpeting that was old and dirty. The mirror frame was broken. The room had a musty smell upon entry. I've seen more modern and fresh bathrooms very old motels that were not as worn. The curtain rod was nearly falling out of the walls. My room was pool side. That does not mean that I had a view of the pool. The pool is located between the highway and the entrance to my room. The early morning traffic sounds were amplified by the pool water and carried well into my room for an early call to rise and shine. The pool area was the nicest of the entire experience. If this is your first time in KeyWest, I would recommend staying closer to OldTown.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: archibalda
Reviews.Content: We paid $149 + tax (with a supposed 30% discount) which is absolulutely OUTRAGEOUS for this badly located, noisy, old, sordid, dirty hotel. Our bathroom floor was badly covered in stains, the carpets were stained as well, a door on our floor had punch holes in it, the elevator was filthy as were the outside floors, the tub rusty and the whole place had a terribly run down air about it. Needless to say the free wi-fi never worked. We understand that Key West is an expensive area and we were there in high season but we regretted booking ahead and we would have done much better (difficult to do worse!!!) going to just about any one of the multitude of guest houses with vacancies. What is most astonishing of all is how hard all the travel sites are pushing this dump which would do better to spend their money on refurbishing than on "advertising" with pictures that are very far from being accurate. One wonders if these properties are ever inspected by the hotel sites. AVOID THIS ONE AT ALL COST !

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy - far from the heart of Key West unless you have car or rent scooter/bike”
Reviews.Author: kms3129
Reviews.Content: While the front desk staff did accommodate our early arrival due to a wedding and the need to get ready early, the room was so loud I didn't sleep for two nights. The balcony overlooked the main road into Key West and was so loud I heard every car and motorcycle go by. This was the least expensive place I found during our stay so I guess you get what you pay for. Not really close to anything so you have to take a cab ($20 average no matter where you went) or rent bikes/scooter which I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what hotel the others reviewers went to...”
Reviews.Author: J L
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible!!! Given the amount I had to pay for a room, I can honestly say that I've slept in motels that were in better condition. We had 2 rooms, and both rooms smelled terribly of smoke (even though they were "non-smoking" rooms) and had a musty/moldy smell that flared everyone's allergies. The lobby is really classy and nice as well as the pool but the hot tub was not working. The mattresses don't have anything but a loose bed sheet covering them (which I find disgustingly unsanitary) and I know the floors hadn't been vacuumed in a long while because my sister walked around bare foot for not any longer than 5 minutes when her feet were completely BLACK. The worst thing of all was probably the fact that the door and its frame were both rotting and you were lucky to be able to open the door on the 10th try. I thought that this was just in the rooms I had but several other people were struggling to get in to their rooms along the 2nd floor. Absolutely unacceptable for the amount charged and will definitely never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back next year!”
Reviews.Author: shawnburns7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take our 12 yr old daughter to the Keys for Christmas this year. We had never been here before so we really didn't know what to expect. Checkin was quick and easy. We headed to the restaurant to eat lunch since we hadnt eaten in 6hrs. Our waitress Fern was very friendly and very nice. Because our trip was over Christmas, we had Christmas dinner in the hotel. The buffet was awesome and again, Fern was our waitress so that made our Christmas dinner fun and didn't think so much about missing dinner with my family back in Maryland. We spent alot of time at the pool. We met the bar tender Georgia, who is a sweetheart as well. She always made sure my kid had a cup of ice cubes :-) the conceiers were able to hook us up with some sightseeing trips and got us a good deal on an electric car for the week to drive back and forth to Duvall st. Our original reservations were for 7 nights, on day 5, we decided to our extend our trip to 8 nights because the hotel staff made us feel at home and we were enjoying our vacationso much that I was not ready to go back to Maryland yet. My husband and I will be back for sure. Probably in May for our anniversary. We will leave the kid at home for that trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good for Key West only if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: Wolverine154
Reviews.Content: Super fast check in and out. Nothing amazing but this refurnished hotel has very large, clean, well appointed and comfortable rooms. The pool is nice. Obviously, it is about 4 miles outside the main Key West walking area but driving from here and parking at a meter near the downtown area was easy. The only drawback was the free wifi. It was almost impossible to connect to and even then keep on. The front desk stated that it was an ongoing problem they were trying to solve with their wifi contractor.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected from the reviews”
Reviews.Author: thewebbers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lexington on November 5th. We booked the hotel through Priceline because I did not want to spend a fortune on a hotel room. Once I found out we were booked at the Lexington, I read the reviews and started to get worried that we were going to be staying in a dump. When we arrived, we spoke to Eva at the front desk. We told her we were there to celebrate my birthday and our ten year wedding anniversary. She upgraded our room for us to a poolside suite. The room was all right, it was what I would have expected for spending $100 for the night. The pool area was out dated but inviting. The breakfast in the restaurant was completely inedible. I cannot believe that anyone in management has tasted the food and thought it tasted good. It was hard to believe someone could screw up pancakes that badly. The one bright spot of our stay was Eva. She was so upbeat and polite and a breath of fresh air. I would not pay full price for the room we had but it was a good deal for $100 per night in Key West. If we got a good rate we would stay there again. Someone should promote Eva to management!

Reviews.Title: “You don't get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Amber B
Reviews.Content: I saw the reviews for this hotel prior to staying there, but got it with the "unpublished rate hotels" on Expedia and didn't have a lot of choice. It lived up to all the reviews and I do not recommend staying there. The windows would not open, bathroom had corrosion on the tile floor and rust around the bath tub, the internet did not work, the room smelled bad and the sink/vanity wasn't cleaned properly. The worst part was that my feet were covered in black after walking around the room without socks or shoes. I did switch rooms at that point, but the new room was not much better.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: james119
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. The room had the most horrible musty smell that you just couldn't get rid of. The windows didn't open so that didn't help. Our TV and phone didn't work and in 3 days our sheets were not changed. We dined in the restaurant. Food was ok but service was terrrible. Unfortunately I have nothing positive to say about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place....”
Reviews.Author: Ronlexus
Reviews.Content: Last minute stay as we decided to stay extra day in keys.everythin was full so ended up at Lexington. During checking, I saw a lady walked out of hotel after cancelling the reservation as she didn't like the room. I didnt pay attention but boy, I shud have. a) we gt a smelly room b) bed bugs at night. My wife had so many bites. It was terrible. DO NOT stay even if hotel offers for free

Reviews.Title: “Very run down”
Reviews.Author: ron4fur
Reviews.Content: I was fooled by the nice poolside pics online. Intact the place is very run down. The building structure looks horrible. Only the lobby area is a little maintained. The rooms were ok. I could see water marks on the carpet. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: johnydolittle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of the cheapest in Key West, with that said you get what you pay for. The Good: Price, pool is nice, however this is the first hotel coming in on US 1, you will literally run into the place if you do not turn left or right at the T which is at the entrance to Key West. The pool has a tiki bar with LCD TVâ€™s which closes too early and the traffic noise from US 1 is tolerable. Georgia is the bartender and a very nice lady. Pool is open until 11. The rooms have kind of been updated, they are trying to make it a step above a Days Inn. The rooms do look nice, but if you look closely you will notice a few little areas where they went cheap. The toilet tank was from a different kind of toilet and didnâ€™t fit properly, the sink must have lost a leg holding it up because they had a permanent make shift thing holding it up. Beds are pretty lame, but for 1 or 2 nights doable. I had a room overlooking the pool with 2 queens. Fridge and microwave are nice to have. No phone by the bed which was kind of a pain. The attached restaurant Kahoots is actually pretty good and the best thing about staying here was the room service was very affordable, I ordered breakfast which was less than $12 for one person, great price for room service. If you plan on doing the Duval thing then this is not your hotel as the taxi will cost you about $40-$50 roundtrip, I am assuming you are not going to drink and drive. You would be better off spending the taxi money on a nicer place within walking distance to Duval and Old Town. If you are driving yourself , you are probably still going to have to pay $10 for parking near Duval. This is the furthest hotel from Duval. Overall the hotel is nice, it is not a Hilton, however itâ€™s not priced as such. Not sure if I would stay there again as being close to Duval is what I would prefer. If you are not a drinker and want a base lay your head this is a good place to do so.

Reviews.Title: “unmaintained but cheap”
Reviews.Author: likwidsage
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not up to 3 star standards. The walls are thin, there is rust in bathtub, stains near the toilet, the wifi goes in and out frequently, the TV channels are hazy at best and there are ants in the room. Honestly the only good things about this place is that they're cheap and the customer service is good. But with care like this, it's easy to figure out why.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff for Fantasy Fest”
Reviews.Author: v_r0d
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Three nights and booked thru priceline and was reluctant by reading other reviews.I called the hotel directly and talked to a nice lady that re-assured me that if I had any problems that they would certainly take care of it..That made me feel better and was excited for my trip..On arrival straight from key west express,we were to early to check in but were allowed to store bags in office so we could take up the sites while we waited..we were reassured that the room was reserved and not going to be resold like some other places I've been in miami....We checked in at midnight and was greeted by nice gentlemen and given coupons for hotel restaurant and fresh baked cookies...we arrived to to our room which was up stairs and faced the wafflehouse.The door was alittle hard to open but just had to push harder..Upon entering you could feel a/c blasting and room was clean...Our room was clean but smelled like mildew...looked at ceiling and noticed a wet spot in vanity area..Figured that was why and called it a night..Waking up coughing,I wondered if that was why because I don't smoke...THe second day when both of us were coughing I knew that was why..Honestly we were just there to sleep and shower so I didn;t even bother asking about it because the rest of the stay at pool(which you cant bring outside drinks into) was great..I would stay here again because I enjoed the staff(calling us taxis and anything else we needed),but not recommend if you have allergies or lung problems...Maybe they will start updating rooms because they definetly have updated lobby by paint differences...on a side note.Taxi services to duval street runs about 15$...If you are lucky enough to have 4 or more people they chare you a airport rate which is $4.50/person...save money and find some friends to ride with or use trolly /train tour...free/29.99/person......Thanks..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff Neglected Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne Marie H
Reviews.Content: After a slow and exhausting drive from Northern Florida (9 hours) my husband and I checked into the Lexington. We were greeted at reception by a friendly and accommodating staff. My review of the hotel room itself is simple because of the filthy rug and shoddy amenities I will never stay there again. It is unfortunate that a hotel can have such a wonderful and upbeat staff and not provide suitable accommodations. This property could be so much more with some much needed upgrades because it already has a great asset and itâ€™s the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay for our 25th Anniv.”
Reviews.Author: Deborah F
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff great pool and the right price. Hotel is a bit old but clean and very friendly and a great value for Key West. The food in the restaurant was wonderful and Fern our server made us feel very special. We look forward to our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Grand name shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom32s
Reviews.Content: Grand name shame about the hotel changed rooms three times and finally gave in , dirty rooms and needs a full refurbishment

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Tationa01
Reviews.Content: This is my second time visiting Key West and the second time was my best hours after seaching for a not so expensive room. I decided to stop at lexington Hotel and the service there was great the lady at the front desk Eva was the best. She accommodated me and my family with a excellent veiw. The next time I come to Key West I will return to Lexington this is now my home away from home when I visit Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: BeachMama_10
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at the Lexington. I was a little apprehensive about staying there because the reviews were pretty harsh. However, my stay was booked on Priceline so I didn't have much choice. It was actually not that bad. The hotel definitely needs some renovation, but it was clean and bug-free. (Yes, I checked for bed bugs.) The pool is very nice and there is a tiki bar that is staffed during the day and early evening. Although the location is not the best--far from downtown Key West, the trolley stop is right out the front door. And there is a new cafe behind the trolley stop with Cuban coffee, sandwiches, etc. The staff members were very friendly and helpful--with the exception of a (heavyset) man in the evening. Avoid him if you can. The ladies are super nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve the ranking it has”
Reviews.Author: djvyrus69
Reviews.Content: Ok in all honesty everyone, is this a luxurious beachfront hotel? No, is this an intimate Duval Street B&B? No. Is it a well appointed hotel trying its best to do well? Yes. I stayed at this hotel this past weekend for my 3 year anniversary after getting an awesome deal through pricline (like I do all my hotels, lol). I showed up at 2pm, and walked in and asked if it would be possible to check in early since me and my wife were celebrating our anniversary. Not only did Eva and Irene check us in early, but she gave us a complimentary upgrade to a Jr. Suite, and free breakfast at the on site restaurant. The room itself was large and in good condition, yea a couple of spots here and there weren't in tip top condition but there are places on Miami Beach and Hollywood Beach that the in room furniture are rubbermaid chairs and they charge you $150 a night. I'm sorry for everyone complaining you have no reason to complain. If you complain about the distance,,,,,the conch train and trolley buses have a stop in front of the hotel. If you complain about the pool...its small, but well appointed and VERY clean If you complain about anything else....guys you're in Key West, look at some of the homes on the island and wonder how it would feel to live there and just enjoy the fact you have a clean comfortable hotel to stay in. I've stayed in worse, and better, but I would definitely be back when I'm in Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh..”
Reviews.Author: YuckyHotel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Lexington when we were in town for a friend's wedding. We got a good price on our room and we were excited because the pictures looked like it would be a great place to stay for my first Key West trip. The room was ok, but the bathroom was dirty and not well kept. We let it go because we weren't planning to spend much time there. We thought the hotel pool and pool bar were great and Georgia at the bar was very friendly. My husband inquired with the concierge about moped rentals because the cab fare was killing us. The concierge was arrogant, rude and didn't offer any helpful information. We asked about bus routes/fares or any option that might be available, but for some reason he wouldnâ€™t offer any information. We left, in another cab, feeling defeated but we tried to let it go. We returned home with what I believe are fleabites on our ankles. The rooms were loud and you could hear every car that drove by. Not to mention, when we returned home we found out our credit card had extra charges, and we have to wait two days before they can be removed. We will definitely return to the Keys, but we will not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Jbann79
Reviews.Content: Found this when we drove into town. Pictures make it look a lot better that it is! We woke up at 2am to little bugs crawling all over us. Again at 3 am to people in a screaming fight that lasted an hour and at 4am we had to listen to a car repeatedly revving it's engine in the parking lot! Huge waste of cash this dirt hole is!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel? More like Apartment Complex”
Reviews.Author: deborah_na08
Reviews.Content: Hello all! I'm so excited to write another review! I went to Key West & stayed for 2 days before I went to Islamorada, Florida for a friends wedding last week! The Lexington is what you would call a 2 star or 3 star hotel. The hotel staff were friendly, but it definitely didn't meet my expectations. The restaurant "In Kahoots" i believe is what it's called, is great! I had the grilled Mahi Mahi sandwich, and my boyfriend had the cuban sandwich...great, but not the best. It's a quaint little place, quiet, and with friendly people. The BEST part of the hotel is its POOL!!! It's an enormous pool with a poolside bar. The bar is way overpriced in my opnion. I paid $9 for a strawberry daquiri...but aside from that the hotel was mediocre in my opnion. The only thing great about the hotel was the pool. So don't be deceived in what you see in the pictures online!!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected...”
Reviews.Author: bowman716
Reviews.Content: Based on the Price Line rating of 2.5 stars @ $80.00 per night; I was satisfied with my stay. With some additional investment/amenities to rooms the property could easily be 3 stars. The Good Stuff: All employees I encountered (front desk, maids, bartender, etc) were freindly and totally professional. Property is from the early 70"s but looks recently updated. Very well maintained/clean with beautiful tropical court yard and pool/hot tub. Ample free parking. Onsite restaurant with reasonably priced food and pool-side tiki bar. My king room was spacious, clean/smelled nice with decent bed and linens. Areas That Need Help: Rooms are extremely loud do to highway traffic, pool music, miss-fitted door, old construction methods and textured walkways that play havoc with roller luggage. Internet is free but too slow/weak to function. Limited TV channels; no HBO (even though it's listed as an active channel). No On-Demand options... Bathroom mirror is mounted too low for anyone close to 6' tall. Bathtub is missing all it's grout? Light fixture over bathtub is not sealed or designed for that application; not safe. Phone was missing directory panel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Ana J
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Key West started with us checking in at the Lexington Hotel Key West. We checked in on 9/24 after an exhausting 3 hr drive from Miami. We were given a double bed room so as I unpacked on one bed my fiance laid on the other to rest. I went to shower and when I came out the shower he got up to find himself covered in what appeared to be fleas or some sort of white bugs (we recorded them with our phone). His entire arm and back of shirt were literally covered with the bugs. We both freaked out, then I found out they were all over my towel so I totally freaked afraid I wiped my body with the towel. We found them all over the beds and table in the room. We called to the front desk and they were to send someone up. I couldn't wait and just wanted out of the room. We shook our belongings, repacked and left. The front desk clerk, Dave, tried to be helpful and moved us to another room and gave us a $20 breakfast coupon (which we didn't use). By now it's midnight, we're tired but headed to room #2, to find this room reaked of mildew. By then we were just fed up and I was nearly in tears, we ended up checking out and moving to another hotel. Mind you they charged us the entire amount which was cancelled but took 4 business days to credit back. So we had to spend several more hundreds of dollars to check into another hotel. Talk about inconvinece and a hit to our wallets. I was told I couldn't speak to a manager until Monday 9/26, when I called first thing in the morning they were in a meeting, called back an hour later and spoke to Rex that pretty much only confirmed the reservation was cancelled, no apologies, no nothing. This was a horrible start to my birthday and first visit to Key West. The pics on the internet are old and do not depict the current status of this hotel. I will never recommend nor stay at this establishment again.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: linisima
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 3 nights and we spent most of the time outside, as really the hotel rooms are pretty worn down and they have this moldy smell, but we were with the kids and didn't want to spend too much money in something fancier. We didn't use the pool, didn't look that appealing, I know the photo makes it look gigantic and spacious but believe, it is not. The concierge was very helpful and we booked our "island adventure" tour with her, so that was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not even there yet, but impressed!”
Reviews.Author: MNartWesternMass
Reviews.Content: Wow - Just spoke with Ryan to request a non-smoking room. It was so nice to talk with such a friendly, welcoming person! Now we're looking forward to out visit to Key West even more! Will add to review soon.

Reviews.Title: “Be encouraged- great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GBGlace
Reviews.Content: I was initially concerned when I got this hotel using a name your own price and then find out the name of the hotel website. Some of the reviews are pretty bad! However, my experience at the Lexington was great! I stayed in a ground level 2 double bed room near the pool. I traveled solo and felt very safe in the hotel and room. The pool area was great. The staff was excellent from start to finish. I was especially grateful to the front desk clerk whose name I cannot remember but started with a T. They were always quick to call a cab, answer a question, and even let me stay past the check out time with no problems at all. The room was clean, no worries there. Beds were fine- overall less fancy than other hotels, but still nice. It is about a 30 minute bike ride from downtown, which was fine for me, but just FYI. I would recommend this hotel to other travelers. The one meal I had at the restaurant wasn't great, but that's not a problem for me because there are so many great places to eat, why would you want to eat at the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: Zyxon
Reviews.Content: Hotel is pretty much ok i guess. Abit too close to to road for my taste. Pool is ok. One big plus for bartender Georgina who was most helpful in guiding us to to places and shops of intrest. She deserves a star on her own.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff!”
Reviews.Author: Alimoon64
Reviews.Content: We had the best customer service. Ryan was extremely helpful and knowledgable. Very friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TASmith48
Reviews.Content: Comfortable accomodations for the price. WiFi worked well in our room. The pool was fantastic, a little on the warm side, but this is south Florida in early September, what would one expect for a pool that sits in the sun? Our room had stone tile floors that were clean and served us well, particularly when returning from the pool. The hotel staff was polite and friendly and very willing to offer advice as to where to go, what to see and the best way to get there. The hotel's restaurant, InKahoots, served excellent food. Their soup offered in their "all you can eat soup and salad bar" was delicious; chicken noodle, chili and cream of celery (which I didn't think I'd care for) became a favorite! The trolley stop is a very short walk next door. Those who panned this hotel would have been better served to stay at the Waldorf Astoria. You get what you pay for and this hotel was well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of work”
Reviews.Author: lionking05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lexington Hotel for the Labor Day weekend. This hotel needs renovation very badly. Everything looks old and even worse ran down. The location is good and yes it was clean. We did not use the swimming pool so I can't comment on that. One thing I liked about the hotel though, they have a desk right next to the front desk and there is a lady there who answers questions about Key West and surrounding area. She makes suggestions about the places to see or places to eat. I thought that was a very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay...”
Reviews.Author: Fabio N
Reviews.Content: Lexington Hotel in Key West, FL, right at the end of the US 1 and just at entrance of the Key, is a nice option for travelers of all kinds. Honest, yet not fancy, the the two-story, motel-like hotel has free parking and comfortable rooms equipped with free high-speed, wi-fi internet connection, glacial air conditioner, microwave oven, frige, and a coffee machine. Front desk personnel is friendly and check-in, quick. A nice swimming pool, surrounded by a green garden, and the contiguous tiki bar, with 2 for 1 happy hour from 4PM thru 7PM, are a nice option for the hottest hours of the day. Hungry? Don't worry....You may either eat at the hotel restaurant, which offers a friendly, prompt service and wallet-friendly prices or anywhere, from pizza to steaks, at a very short driving distance from hotel, by simply turning left on the hotel-front avenue. Lazzy? Hotel friendly "no problem" in response to your request for a free, late checkout avoid the last-moment pressure travelers are usually subject to.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Tipton
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend came to Key West for a couple of days. We stayed at the Lexington Hotel Key West because of the price. We didn't have any reservations and when we walked in the girl at the reception desk gave us a good price. I Think her name was Eva or Eve, started with an "E" for sure. She was very friendly and let us checkin right away as soon as we walked in, which was pretty early around 10 or 11 am. The room was clean and in an OK condition. Nothing too fancy, but for the price it was fair.TV was a little fuzzy so we called the reception desk and Maira was very kind and pleasent, she sent an engineer right away who fixed in within 5 minutes - so it wasn't a big deal. The only improvement could be done with the male staff on duty. I believe we spoke to a couple of men at the desk during later hours and they were a little short and not as friendly as the two women we dealt with before, but it wasn't a big deal. The pool area was very nice and Sergie at the tiki bar was an excellent bartender. We also had breakfest in the morning, and it was ok. The wait time was a little longer than we expected and the waitress wasn't too happy to be there either. But overall it was a good experience, very fair for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Larry82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night with my girlfriend. I would not reccommend this hotel but i'll try to make a list of pros and cons. Pros: - good price for key west room - free parking Cons: - very old room (our tv wasn't even in the room when we got there; they changed us to another room where we had a tv but were missing the telephone..comical) - far from downtown key west - breakfast is poor and pretty expensive - found some sort of red cockroaches in the room just before leaving the hotel in the morning - they say they have free wifi but we couldn't get hold of it with our smartphones All in all, if you want to save for a night, you might as well give it a try. We certainly wont go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Key West”
Reviews.Author: Larry C
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent several days at the Lexington and found positive and negative reactions to our stay. The most positive was the attention we were given when several things were not very pleasing regarding our room. The young man that was on one of the shifts was the most helpful and professional and I believe his name was Ryan. He was a great help each day we saw him and we also noticed he was helpful to other customers. He appeared to be well versed in the sites we should see and guided us toward some wonderful reestaurants that were tucked away from the maddening crowds of Duval St. I take time to comment on this because I am in the customer satisfaction business and people like this young man are far and few and should be recognized. As far as the hotel, your poolside is lovely but wish the bar offered more choices. The rooms, however, were a disappointment as they were very run down and dirty. The bottom of our feet were black after walking on the floors just after a short period of time. No excuse for this. Rooms don't have to be fancy, but cleanliness has no excuse. Our bathroom also looked like it needed total reconstruction. I will think twice and probably pay a little more money next time to get better accommodations for my family.

Reviews.Title: “Okay location (if you have a car), but terrible, moldy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shathiyah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lexington for one night during our visit to Key West. It is far away from Duval Street, but if you have a car, then it is fine. Got a decent price, but the room was very dirty and had a terrible moldy smell. The main reception area is located in a separate building and has no air condition. Once we arrived in our room, we found the floors were very dirty and the room had a moldy smell. The doors and walls are so thin, that it was hard to sleep at night (you can hear anyone and everyone moving in the walkway outside). Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is terrible there's grease all outside the hotel in the back and I wouldn't stay here again even if it was free!!!”
Reviews.Author: Herpotolagist4
Reviews.Content: Its disgusting there bathrooms had black mold and when you opened your door you got the smell of cooking grease and it had mold all over the parking lot its disgusting!!! Don't waste your money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms, reasonable staff”
Reviews.Author: EMONiceville
Reviews.Content: Had booked reservation for 3 nights- STAYED 1. first was given wrong type of room.- Moved to a 2nd room, it had a cracked tub/shower with pieces lying in the tub! There was mouse/roach feces in the tub and bathroom. Moved to a 3rd room- the bathroom door would not close- it was actually too big for the door frame, UNBELIEVABLE! Checked out the next morning and booked a B&B in Old Town. The staff tried to be accomodating with all these problems and were courteous when I checked out. They refunded all my charges. I actually felt sorry for the people working there. Good people, bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wingnuter
Reviews.Content: After driving 12 hrs and getting there at 1:pm My wife and I had to check in and use restrooms. We were told that check in time was 4:00pm. I paid $160 for 8hr at a hotel?????????? Unbelievable. Room carpet was filthy, Ice maker was broken we had to go across the street to get Ice. Staff was very unfriendly. We left after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bestfroggy
Reviews.Content: Well to start off with my husband and I were looking forward to a wonderful stay at Key West, we were celebrating our Anniversary. The Lexington Hotel, is nothing like they specify on the picturesâ€¦ The front desk employees where NOT PROFESSIONAL at allâ€¦ It doesnâ€™t matter what type of day you are having or what problems you are having with management you must keep professional at all timesâ€¦ Once our room was given to us we went to settle in and the toilet was clogged up, we wasted a hole day and half of the evening to have it fixed, meanwhile we couldnâ€™t use the bathroom. The room was dark, dingy, and the carpet had stains in themâ€¦ There was about 1 Â½ inch of a gap, between the door and the floor; we had to place extra sheets on the floor so no insects could come in. The bed was a king size bed and it was very uncomfortable and it smelled like mildew and mold, defiantly the sheets or the bed had something in them I ended up having a horrible allergic reactionâ€¦ As far as the swimming pool goes, WATCH OUT donâ€™t be fooled, the pool is nothing like the picturesâ€¦. Optical illusions will fool you!!!! Needless to say that my husband and I ended up cutting our trip short!!! One more thing, as far as pricing goes, the price we paid for the hotel was not cheap either!!! Hope this review helps others in deciding where to stayâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and rude personell”
Reviews.Author: BwiseLizzy
Reviews.Content: Ok we arrived quite early, we sometimes do, but this is the first hotel where they say come back over 3 hours, and we could not even store our luggage. And then we arrived in the room, the smell was not so nice. The beds very small and the room looked very old and dirty. I even doubt if the sheets on the beds were clean ones.

Reviews.Title: “I would never go back to that hotel, even if they offer me a $1,000,000.”
Reviews.Author: Aldana1987
Reviews.Content: Overall experience: Negative. Since we got there, the person who was at the reception was completely rude. Then, when we got to the room, the smell was horrific, it was like a humid-moldy type of odor, this is not including the spider that we found in our room. Next morning, we went to the reception to see if we could get another room and the representative(which I will keep anonymous for her own reputation) told us in a very nice way that she was going to arrange a new room for us. When we got to the "hotel" in the afternoon, the "manager"(which she is very unprofessional) didn't know what we were talking about after explaining that we have requested a new room, she did provide a key for a new room, but told us to go ourselves to check the room (with no apology ), we did get the new room, but Tatiana (unprofessional manager) didn't offer help to move our belongings and demanded that we needed to leave the stinky room in 30 min (again, no apology for the WHOLE inconvenience) When we get to the new room, which is was on the forth floor by the way, the key didn't work, so we called the reception and ask for someone to assist us. The "unprofessional manager TATIANA" went to "help us" and she gave us the most stupid excuse about why the door didn't open(FYI, PPL PLEASE PULL UP THE HANDLE TO OPEN THE DOOR). So, needless the say, I did complaint to " the unprofessional manager Tatiana" and she never apologize because of the whole inconvenience that we went through. I would never go back to that hotel, even if they offer me a $1,000,000. I really dislike the attitude of the staff and the only thing that they did it was a 30% back to us for the 1st night ONLY. What an insult!!!! Oh yeah, by the way, the toilets doesn't really work either. NEVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, pasted it's prime hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayyay
Reviews.Content: The Lexington is probably the first hotel you will see when you arrive in Key West. It's about as far as you can get from the old town while still being on the island. Although there are many restates and shops also at this location. The old town is 10 minutes drive. The hotel has two main buildings we stayed in one which was slightly away from the main complex, it was in the middle of a car park with parking bays and a bike rental shop underneath. The walk to the pool was not ideal as it was through the car park. The buildings are old and slightly run down. Ice machine out of service, door to room coming the the hinges. The was also no room safe and the wi-fi didn't work. The swimming pool was an ok size, it was about 1.6 meters deep but you couldn't see the bottom. It was an ok stay but I wouldn't recommend it. It could of been worse.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price!! Great Place!! Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: JMIRISH333
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I stayed at The Lexington the second week of June 1011. This place is GREAT! Great Staff, Great rooms, Great pool, Great pool bar. I honestly don't know why this place get such terrible reviews. We landed and went right to the hotel. The lady behind the counter was extremely friendly. I mentioned to her that I was a fan of the hotel on Facebook and she instantly upgraded our rooms to Suites!! We walked into our upgraded suite and it took my breath away. 2 rooms with flat screen tv's, a full size dining room table, a pull out couch and 2 bathrooms! After dropping off our luggage we headed out to the pool/pool bar area. The bartender Sergio was awesome! He whipped us up a few frozen concoctions, that were NOT lacking in alcohol, and we hit the pool. After an hour or so in the pool we decided to do lunch at InKahoots restaurant. The food was AMAZING!!! The whole week at this hotel was SUPERB, not one thing went wrong! I would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful with Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: maic34227
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked decent from the outside and wasn't very bad since it wasn't too far from town. We were given a second floor room on the a joining building to the main building. BUT later that night we got the SURPRISE of our lifetime. There were bed bugs that came out to play. WTH? I have never seen bed bugs in my whole life! My mother thought it was a joke and that they weren't real bugs since it was a hotel. But sure enough, as she continued to dicover more of them coming out throughout the night that was it! The rest of my group slept on top of the covers until the next day when I had to request another room. The ladies up front were surprised that we hd bed bugs! Are you FREAKEN serious? I'm there to have fun, not worry about bed bugs!! The most awful place ever. For the price I paid to stay at this place I might as well had stayed at the Courtyard!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again-expected more for over $100 a night”
Reviews.Author: LMM2011
Reviews.Content: Some good things-pool and hot tub were nice. Now the vent: 4 of the 7 machines in the gym were broken/malfunctioning. Bathroom door didnt close. Housekeeping never cleaned our room, even after we asked repeatedly, ended up going to front desk to get fresh towels. There was no 'wecome' book, bible, note pad or pen, or do-not-disturb sign in our room. A/c was broken and would turn on every 10 mins-rumble to death then kick back on in 10 minutes. 1 of the two beds had springs sticking out (you could see them) and the other wasnt much better for support. We left early and front desk didnt seem to care or even ask why we werent staying for our entire reservation. they advertise mini fridge and microwave in the rooms- our mini fridge was broken worse than one from a frat house and there was no microwave. the cable tv- 1/2 the time the cable didnt work. Majority of the plugs in the room didnt work-ended up charging cell phones in the car. very noisey being right next to US1. We will never stay at this place again. We are thinking about sending our Chiropractic bills to their office for payment- that is how bad the beds are. I do think the health department or someone should be aware of the level of quality in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Reodor1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights with children. The receptionist was unfriendly and inconsiderate, the rooms were badly maintained and not properly cleaned - in fact rather filthy and smelled of mold. The furniture in the room was partly falling apart. No fridge in room. Heavily trafficated road right outside the room, aircondition was ineffective and extremely noisy. This hotel do not hold the standard of a three star hotel - it is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The only positive experience in this hotel was the concierge, who was very helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: ildauraclaus
Reviews.Content: Terrible service. Need urgently classes on Customer Services. It took them two days to get a rubber bath mat to put in the tub so we would not slip during showering or bathing. Everytime we ask it was on the way, they did not have in the hotel, the manager went out to buy it or really you did not need one. Have you ever heard the term slippery when wet. And I was on vacation with my parents of 75 and 66, imagine one fall. And if you asked them a question it was always no. Or ask our Concierge. Thank god for Key West Concierge, Jamie Smith KUDOS only to her. We even had termites in our room. We overheard another guest complain about the termites and they laugh.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: kahmedsid
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that it is almost impossible to find cheap lodging in the Old Town Key West area and that is where you'd want to be. This hotel is about 3.5 miles away from all the action (Duval Street) and offers exceptionally low rates. That is how you get trapped! I have nothing good to say about this hotel at all but plenty of bad: 1. Rooms with carpet are mold infested and the hotel doesn't care 2. Rooms without carpet are also mold infested and that is due to the air conditioners 3. You would not be able to breathe with the amount of mold in the rooms 4. The front-desk staff were not friendly and made a face changing my room 5. When I complained about mold, they asked some guy to go in and spray some cheap deodorant. That was pretty absurd. 6. Sandpaper like towels which are also up for sale if you wall in love with them. Maybe their idea of humor. I feel that they have pretty big and nice rooms and they can do so much better if they pay attention to proper hygiene and cleanliness, but apparently the management doesn't care. They had a big pool but we were scared to go in given the cleanliness standards elsewhere in the hotel. Please spend the extra $30-$40 a night and stay somewhere near Duval street; it will not only save your trip but make it a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Hope there's 0 in the rating scale...”
Reviews.Author: Marryannebling
Reviews.Content: Was our first time in key west and we had a hard time looking for an available room on a Friday night so we ended up in this roach hotel for a price of $134.. Pictures from d Internet was good but once u entered d room reality sets in...night time - flying termites looking for lights so we ended upturning bathroom lights..toilet that won't flush so u need a plunger at hand filthy shower room and unwashed towels so no shower for 2 days.. Had a hard time sleeping looks like the pillow was just used.. Oh d carpet.. Had to wipe my shoes with cavi wipes every now and then.. I have one recommendation.. Renovate or close it down baby instead of sucking up our money.. That hotel should cost 20 bucks a night... Learned a lesson too.. Book ur hotel a month before and read reviews...

Reviews.Title: “Do Not stay here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kwatson80
Reviews.Content: Front desk rude, bathroom had mildew on the tiles and standing water in the tub, over charged me at the restaurant what more is there to say

Reviews.Title: “Unrivalled in it's hideousness.”
Reviews.Author: junkinthetrunkuk
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights at the lexington last minute as it was the only place with availability and it didn't take long to find out why. On arrival the desk did not have our reservation and we had to wait for 2 hours for them to sort it out. When we finally got our room it was like stepping into a scene from The Shining, I'm sure the decor has not been touched since 1969! the carpet was rank, the bathroom was mouldy, the bed was actually quite comfortable but don't look underneath! also, the pool was like a cappuccino it had so much scum on top... Each time we were in reception we heard people complaining... Needless to say we checked out and moved to a B&B off Duval. Im gutted that we spent $300ish there.. STAY AWAY. in your car would be better

Reviews.Title: “Sadly, All True”
Reviews.Author: skipmays
Reviews.Content: "Awful" is perhaps putting it mildly. Soggy wet (not damp, but soaked) carpet, musty smell (wonder why?), mildewed shower and bath, little or no sympathy from staff. Slept fully dressed on top of bed because no rooms left in Key West when we tried to check-out after seeing the mess. Not one of our better trips.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: KGMiami
Reviews.Content: They made me wait 2 hours to check in while they waited for the reservations department to fax my info over. The last time I faxed something was in the 90s. Anyway, they didn't seem to be bothered that they were wasting my vacation time and I had to finally convince them to finally get me a room and create another reservation only to find roaches in the shower! To add insult to injury they double charged my credit card...results still pending. This place is unrivaled in its hideousness. If you want to relax and enjoy go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place at all”
Reviews.Author: tigz1019
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews I was a little nervous to stay here but I was surprised.... it was pretty decent. Clean rooms and we had a pool view. Happy hour at the pool bar each day and very polite staff. Only thing is cabs to Duval street are $15-$20 each way (with tip). Overall good time though

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: cece322
Reviews.Content: The carpet was old and definitely do not walk on it barefoot but the beds were clean and comfy!! The staff was friendly and it was definitely worth the price! We went during Spring Break and you couldn't have fund a better deal!!

Reviews.Title: “Get in get out”
Reviews.Author: suziecq3
Reviews.Content: Photos are deceiving. This hotel is from the early 1950's. Beware, the walls were missing layers of plaster, in numerous places. Appeared that they just painted over it. The sink was falling off the wall by at least 1 1/2 inches. You could see the layers of tile in the tub area that were bowed out. You could smell the cars fumes that were parked at your door, and I did not feel safe. I asked the receptionist where could I find ice. Apparently she did not understand English, and could not figure out what I was saying. As we arrived at 10:00 pm looking in the room we knew to take just our pjs in the room and no luggage, because we did not want to be leaving with anything extra! This is a drive by hotel. DON'T STOP here in at the Lexington Hotel in Key West, FL.

Reviews.Title: “the good,the bad and the really ugly”
Reviews.Author: tutster2
Reviews.Content: this has to have been the worst hotel i have ever stayed at. everthing is inconvenient including the location.staff was not helpful or courtious at all. ceiling leeked when it rained. one icre machine for 400 rooms and itdidn't work half the time.not allowed to take your own drinks to pool. hot tub was dirty. street noise is ungodly. restraunt food was good but service lousy..paid a premium for poolside room and could not even see the pool..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was Worth the Disounted Rates we were abel to get, it is not worth the Standard rate.”
Reviews.Author: Mandy52210
Reviews.Content: Lexington Hotel Key West was worth the price that we paid for it, however, be warned that we were able to get this hotel at last minute at a very good price on one particvular travel site. All other sites had this hotel at $60 higher per night, I do not feel the hotel is worth that standard price. While the pool area was GREAT (our favorite part of the hotel), the front desk staff was very unfriendly. They also were not the most organized. The rooms were average. And the location...you are quite aways from the Key West action. Luckily we had friends that were staying across the street and were able to catch their hotels shuttle with them. Otherwise we would have had to pay about $25 each way for a cab each night we wanted to go to town.

Reviews.Title: “Conch Trap!”
Reviews.Author: garyed2626
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. We booked this hotel for five days and each was an adventure. Although we had asked for an early check in, when we arrived, we were told that no rooms were available. Consequently we checked our bags and toured the island. When we later came back to check in, it turned awful. We asked to get our bags and they just handed us without asking to see the stub of the tags they had put on them when we left them. They just handed us bags including one that was not ours! When we got to our room, it was not what we had requested. We had asked for a second floor room with a view of the pool. Instead, we had a ground floor room with a head on view of the exterior wall of the building. When we contacted the front desk and asked for another room, we were refused. This place was unbelievable. The people at the front desk (especially the women) were rude and offensive. It was as if we were a bother to them. Our room had a musty odor. We complained about it and three days later they sprayed something that was to mask it, but then we had that smell to contend with. Water in the ice bucket was not emptied most days and on one day our used glasses were not replaced. Behind the nightstand was an uncovered electrical outlet. Rooms were noisy, in part, from the trucks on the main highway running in front of the hotel. The carpet was dirty and worn. The pool, however, was very nice, but that hardly made up for all the other shortcomings. All in all, this was the worst place we have stayed in many, many years and one to be avoided.

HotelInfo.Name: Lexington Hotel Key West
HotelInfo.Address: 3850 North Roosevelt Boulevard, Key West, FL 33040 (Formerly Hotel Key West)
